title: What part of Spain do most people from Canary Islands descend from? - Quora

response.answer_text: Apealling question. As far as I know after the demographic collapse derivated from the conquest, the archipielago was recolonized by inmigrants mainly from Andalucia but also from Galicia,Castilla and Portugal. However it would be a shame not to mention the persistence of a native population as well as a important presence of genovese and flamingo merchants and a north african significant body of slaves.

To confirm some of the answers below, my Canary Island ancestors came from Caceres, Spain and the Extremadura region. Some of them may have come from Badajoz. There is evidence that some, but not all were expelled as Jews in 1492. They all seem to be practicing Catholics by the mid- 16th Century. Most of them arrived in Canary Islands in that period, the mid-16th Century.
